info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 8:27PM CDT until April 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WISE AND DENTON COUNTIES... At 827 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Krum to near New Fairview, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Frisco, Denton, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Grapevine, The Colony, Southlake, Corinth, Highland Village, Trophy Club, Lake Dallas, Sanger, northwestern Lake Lewisville, Briar, Little Elm, Roanoke, Pecan Acres, Krum, Pilot Point and Argyle. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for north central Texas. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
